Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.controller

Class UIController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.controller.UIController
All Implemented Interfaces:
LambdaObserver
public class UIController
extends java.lang.Object
implements LambdaObserver
This is the class through which bot cli and gui interact with the server. Its methods are wrappers for the various messages the server expects to receive, so that both cli and gui are ensured to communicate consistently.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static UIController getInstance()

    • startLocalSinglePlayerGame

      public void startLocalSinglePlayerGame​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Called instead of the setNickname, joinLobby and setCreation methods when starting a local game. Creates a mock remote view so that all the messages and the structures of the remote games can be used for the local ones.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's nickname.

    • send

      private void send​(Transmittable message)
      Acts as wrapper around the send function so the methods invoke this whether game is local or remote.
      Parameters:
      message - the message being transmitted to the server/view.

    • sendNickname

      public void sendNickname​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String host, int port) throws java.io.IOException
      Invoked by cli and gui after nickname selection to make first contact with server. Creates a ClientSetNicknameMessage and establishes connection.
      Parameters:
      nickname - user's chosen nickname.
      host - hostname of the server.
      port - port on which server is running.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there are problems with the socket.

    • joinLobby

      public void joinLobby()

    • setCreation

      public void setCreation​(int playersNum)
      Called by the first player upon receiving the SET_COUNT message.
      Parameters:
      playersNum - the number of players expected to start the game.

    • chosenStartingResources

      public void chosenStartingResources​(java.util.Map<Id,​Resource> idResourceMap, LeaderCard[] chosen)
      Method called by UI after choosing the two leader cards and the resources from initial selection.
      Parameters:
      idResourceMap - Maps resources to deposits.
      chosen - contains the two leader cards.

      public void buyTargetCard​(Id id)

    • activateProduction

      public void activateProduction()

    • disconnectFromServer

      public void disconnectFromServer()

    • resumeGameFromFile

      public void resumeGameFromFile()
      Called instead of joinLobby() after receiving the OK_NICK when restoring a game from file. Sets the loadFromGame parameter to true, used by Lobby.handleJoiningRequest() to differentiate new games from restored ones. If it fails, a disconnectionMessage is received.

    • loadGameFromFile

      public void loadGameFromFile()
      Called instead of setCreation upon receiving the SET_COUNT when restoring a game from file (only by the first player). Sets the size to the one of the original game. If it succeeds OK_COUNT is received, while CLIENT_ERROR is received in case of failure. Once everyone has joined, a ServerReconnectionMessage followed by the appropriate SeverStartTurnMessage are received.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      For ease of testing only! This special message triggers the end of the game, no matter the stage. Called by the 1492 hidden code.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      To be called by the current player during their turn if they wish to save the game. All players will be disconnected as result.

    • reconnectToServer

      public void reconnectToServer​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String host, int port) throws java.io.IOException
      Called when attempting to reconnect to a game after closing the client or losing the connection. A RECONNECTION_OK status message will be received if the reconnection is successful, followed by a ServerGameReconnectionMessage. Otherwise a DisconnectionMessage will close the newly reopened connection if something went wrong.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname under which the player is trying to reconnect
      host - the server hostname
      port - the server port
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - When failing to open the socket.

    • getClientConnection

      public Connection getClientConnection()

    • isLocal

      public boolean isLocal()
